albums.name: In These Silent Days
tracks: You and Me on the Rock (featuring Lucius)
albums.description: In These Silent Days is the seventh studio album by American singer-songwriter Brandi Carlile.
reviews: Seven albums in, Carlile has long since proven herself constitutionally incapable of making a bad record. She’s not about to start now. -Entertainment Weekly
“In These Silent Days” consolidates Carlile’s strengths: musical, writerly, maternal, political. -The New York Times

albums.name: RENAISSANCE
albums.description: Renaissance is the seventh studio album by American singer Beyoncé.”.
reviews: Renaissance is both backward-looking and forward-thinking. A colorful, euphoric and glittery celebration of what has passed and what is still to come. -HipHopDX

While less vulnerable than Lemonade, RENAISSANCE takes the reins as Beyoncé's grandest record to date because of the technical achievements in production and seemingly effortless experimentation without losing any of her lyrical cool. ... Beyoncé's RENAISSANCE is a modern classic. -Exclaim

tracks: All Night Parking (with Erroll Garner) Interlude
albums.description: 30 is the fourth studio album by English singer-songwriter Adele.
reviews: The richest and most musically adventurous album of her career. -The A.V. Club

This is certainly her strongest album yet, a work of catharsis, therapy and succour. It does what pop music is greatest at: gathering up emotions, focusing them and pouring them out to songs that everybody can sing, but few can sing quite as well as Adele. -The Telegraph (UK)

albums.name: Divide
albums.description: ÷ is the third studio album by English singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran. It was released on 3 March 2017 through Asylum Records and Atlantic Records. Castle on the Hill and Shape of You were released as the album's lead singles on 6 January 2017.
reviews: Sheeran's musical history lesson is both well-timed and rip-roaringly fun, another example of his still-evolving craft. -Rolling Stone

As calculating as Sheeran can seem here, he understands there is a fine line between universal and generic, which is why he gives his songs the idiosyncratic touches they need to stand out. -Los Angeles Times

albums.name: Stories
albums.description: Stories is the second studio album by Swedish electronic music producer Avicii, released on 2 October 2015 by PRMD Music and Island Records.
reviews: The pleasing, alive, and diverse Stories is a fine reason to think of Avicii as a producer of attractive music, with EDM, pop, and all other genres on a sliding scale. -AllMusic
As on True, the nondance tracks are more or less power ballads, albeit with fairly pallid vocals.... The dance tracks are actually where most of this album's pleasant surprises lie. -Billboard.com

albums.name: Stoney
albums.description: Stoney is the debut studio album by American rapper and singer Post Malone. It was released on December 9, 2016, by Republic Records. The album features guest appearances from Justin Bieber, Kehlani, and Quavo. The deluxe edition was released on the same day. It features an additional guest appearance from 2 Chainz.
reviews: Malone does an excellent job throughout the album of blending instrumentals with slow and stirring vocals. Malone gets some production help from big names like DJ Mustard, Metro Boomin, and Toronto-based producer Frank Dukes. -Riff Magazine

Malone introduced himself to the world with “White Iverson” in 2015, showing his potential.  The record, reprised here on his debut Stoney showed that there was something there.  The same can be said of Stoney, a flawed debut with its moments.  -The Musical Hype

albums.name: Trilogy
tracks: House of Balloons / Glass Table Girls
